intro: Grumilea mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao grumihua, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to white. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
